results.title: Veneering by the hammer method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Introduction to veneers, topside and underside, Keying the ground on a radio cabinet, applying the glue and using the hammer, gouging out the corners and inlaying.

results.title: Veneering by the caul method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Four-piece veneer decoration of a panel. The film demonstrates: drawing the design on paper in actual size, making a template and cutting the veneers, laying it down on paper, use of the veneer hammer, transferring to the panel, cramping, removing the paper base and cleaning-up
results.description:

results.title: Union is strength: the story of plywood
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
The structure of wood makes it liable to split or be broken along the grain. This film describes how this tendency can be overcome by the construction of plywood.
results.title_for_label: Union is strength: the story of plywood

results.title: Sharpening and grinding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
This film shows an array of tools which it is essential to keep sharp. These include the chisel, paring chisel, mortise chisel, the gouge and other curved tools, the cutting edges of all of which need to be kept sharp on an oilstone. The correct way of doing this is shown in detail and the latter half of the film describes the regrinding of tools, ending with a reminder that rust is thae principal enemy of steel tools. This can be kept down by frequent sharpening and the use of vaseline on the tools when put away for any length of time.

results.title: Saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Show correct stance for using saws. Points out main part of a saw, and gives description of the teeth found in various types of saw. From the series “Basic Woodwork”.
